name: ping
description: Tests network connectivity to a host
explanation: Sends ICMP echo requests to test if a host is reachable and measure round-trip time
useCase: First step in troubleshooting connectivity issues

name: traceroute
description: Shows the path packets take to reach a destination
explanation: Displays each hop (router) between your computer and the destination
useCase: Identify where network latency or packet loss occurs

name: ipconfig/ifconfig
explanation: Shows IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS servers
useCase: Check your network adapter settings

name: nslookup
description: Query DNS servers for domain information
explanation: Queries DNS servers to resolve domain names to IP addresses
useCase: Troubleshoot DNS resolution issues

name: netstat
explanation: Shows active connections, listening ports, and network statistics
useCase: Check what ports are open

name: arp
explanation: Shows the ARP table mapping IP addresses to MAC addresses on local network
useCase: Check MAC address mappings and diagnose Layer 2 issues

name: route
explanation: Shows the routing table used to determine where packets should be sent
useCase: Verify routing paths and troubleshoot routing issues

name: dig
explanation: Provides detailed DNS query information including TTL, nameservers, and record types
useCase: Advanced DNS troubleshooting and checking DNS propagation

name: hostname
explanation: Shows the name assigned to the computer on the network
useCase: Verify device identification on network

name: curl
explanation: Makes HTTP requests to test web connectivity and retrieve headers/content
useCase: Test if websites are accessible and check HTTP response codes

name: telnet
explanation: Opens a connection to a specific port to test if it's open and accessible
useCase: Test if specific services (HTTP, SMTP, etc.) are reachable

name: pathping
description: Combines ping and traceroute with statistics
explanation: Shows route and measures packet loss at each hop over time
useCase: Identify which hop is causing packet loss or latency

name: ipconfig release/renew
explanation: Releases current IP address and requests a new one from DHCP server
useCase: Fix IP configuration issues or get a new IP address

name: flush DNS cache
explanation: Clears cached DNS entries to force fresh DNS lookups
useCase: Fix DNS issues after DNS records have changed

name: ss (socket statistics)
explanation: Shows detailed information about network sockets and connections
useCase: Monitor active connections and listening services

name: iwconfig
explanation: Shows wireless connection details including SSID, signal strength, and connection speed
useCase: Diagnose wireless connectivity and signal strength issues

name: scan WiFi networks
explanation: Lists all nearby WiFi networks with signal strength and security type
useCase: Check for wireless interference and available networks

name: tcpdump
explanation: Captures raw network traffic for detailed packet analysis
useCase: Deep dive into network traffic to diagnose complex issues

name: nmap
explanation: Scans network hosts to discover open ports and running services
useCase: Identify what services are running on network devices

name: speedtest
explanation: Measures download/upload speed and latency to nearest server
useCase: Verify if customer is getting expected internet speeds

name: show VLAN
explanation: Shows VLAN assignments and tagging configuration
useCase: Troubleshoot VLAN segmentation and network isolation issues

name: openssl s_client
explanation: Tests SSL/TLS handshake and displays certificate information
useCase: Diagnose HTTPS connection issues and verify certificates

name: ethtool
explanation: Shows link speed, duplex mode, and network adapter statistics
useCase: Check physical connection status and speed/duplex mismatches

name: show NAT table
explanation: Shows Network Address Translation mappings for private to public IP
useCase: Troubleshoot port forwarding and NAT connectivity issues

name: show firewall rules
explanation: Lists active firewall rules and blocked traffic
useCase: Identify if firewall is blocking legitimate traffic
